page.title: 03LEISURE ON EXMOOR
page.content: In 1970, Somerset County Council bought nearly 2000 acres of Exmoor, as their contribution towards European Conservation Year. The purchase included two farms, Driver and Pinkery. It also included a unique area of wild moorland known as the Chains. The County Council were keen to improve the amemites for the public on Exmoor by providing public access to this remote area and also hope to ensure the conservation of this unique area. Driver farm has been let to a tenant to be formed on traditional Exmoor lines. Pinkery Farm was given to Somerset Education Committee to be used as an Exploration Centre by the children of Somerset.
